newsitem.title: IRAN: IRAN OIL REVENUE SLIGHTLY UNDER BUDGET.
newsitem.headline: IRAN OIL REVENUE SLIGHTLY UNDER BUDGET.

text.p: Iran's oil revenue in the first four months of the Iranian year (March 21-July 21) hit $5.5 billion, Deputy Oil Minister Hojatollah Ghanimifard said on Thursday.
"We were slighly below the budget. The main reason was the lower per barrel price that the crude had and accordingly the lower price of products the market could offer," Ghanimifard told Reuters.
The 12-month Iranian budget ending March 1998 is based on an estimated $17.7 billion in oil earnings using an average price for five Iranian crudes of $17.50 a barrel.
Iranian Oil Minister Gholamreza Aghazadeh said in July that earnings from oil exports in the three months to June 21 reached $4.1 billion, some six percent below the budgeted amount.
Oil accounts for 80 percent of Iran's total export earnings and 40 percent of all government revenues.
President Mohammad Khatami on Wednesday warned that government revenues were below budget targets.
